page.title: 15Parish Meeting
page.content: A fast disapearing phenomenon is the Parish Meeting, run by a chairman and clerk, open to all parishoners who join in free unstructured discussions. Small parishes like Kelly (100) and Bradstone (41) are considered invaiable administratively. Local Government Act 1972 requires convenient grouping of Paris Meetings. Therefore from May 1987 Kelly and Bradstone will be grouped to form a Parish Council with representation of 5 Kelly and 2 Bradstone councillors, ratio of 1 per 20 electors. The 2 Parish Meetings first held December 1894. The last meeting will be Lady Day 1987. First meeting of Kelly and Bradstone Parish Council 1st May 1987.
